actions-list.actionItem: Pursuant to the order of yesterday, the Journal of the proceedings of the Senate was deemed approved to date.
Pursuant to the order of yesterday,the morning hour being deemed expired, and the times for the recognition of the two leaders being reserved.
The following transactions of morning business occurred on today.

H.R. 3935 (Rep. Graves):
        A bill to amend title 49, United States Code, to reauthorize and improve the Federal Aviation Administration and other civilaviation programs, and for other purposes.

        -- Considered by Senate.

        -- Cloture motion on the measure withdrawn by unanimous consent in Senate.
 

 S.Amdt. 1292 (Sen. Murray):
        In the nature of a substitute.

        --Considered by Senate.

        --Cloture motion on amendment SA1292 withdrawn by unanimous consent in Senate.


 S.Amdt. 1293 (Sen. Schumer):
        To add an effective date.

        --Considered by Senate.


 S.Amdt. 1294 (Sen. Schumer):
        To add an effective date.

        --Considered by Senate.


 S.Amdt. 1295 (Sen. Schumer):
        To modify the effective date.

        --Considered by Senate.




 H.R. 5860 (Rep. Granger):
        A bill making continuing appropriations for fiscalyear 2024, and for other purposes.

        -- Received in the Senate, read twice, considered, read the third time, and passed, under the order of 9/30/23, having achieved 60 votes in the affirmative, without amendment by Yea-Nay Vote. 88 - 9. Record Vote Number:247 


        -- Message on Senate action sent to the House.


 S. 2231 (Sen. Merkley):
        A bill to amend title V of the Social Security Actto support stillbirth prevention and research, and for other purposes.

        -- Senate Committee on Finance discharged by Unanimous Consent.

        -- Passed Senate without amendment by Unanimous Consent.


 S.Res. 310 (Sen. Peters):
        A resolution recognizing the Motorcycle Safety Foundation for 50 years of safety education.

        -- Senate Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation discharged by Unanimous Consent.

        -- Resolution agreed to in Senate without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent.


 S.Res. 390 (Sen. Shaheen):
        A resolution designating the week of October 1, 2023, through October 7, 2023, as "National Community Policing Week".

        -- Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent.


 S.Res. 391 (Sen. Grassley):
        A resolution designating the week beginning October 15, 2023, as "National Character Counts Week".

        -- Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent.


 S.Res. 392 (Sen. Hirono):
        A resolution recognizing and honoring the first responders and those who lost their lives in the Maui wildfires in August 2023 that affected thousands of people.

        -- Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent.


 S.Res. 393 (Sen. Tillis):
        A resolution to honor the life and death of DuncanMcLauchlin ("Lauch") Faircloth, former Senator for the State of North Carolina.

        -- Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent.

Under the authority of the order of today, at  9:46 p.m, the Presiding Officer (Ms. Klobuchar in the chair) declared the Senate adjourned, under its order of today, until  3 p.m. on Tuesday, October 3, 2023.
